title: Shares of S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) Drops by -1.42%
text:
By Jason May - Aug 9, 2015 
  dropped 1.42% during the past week, however, the bigger picture is still very bullish; the shares have posted positive gains of 0.49% in the last 4 weeks. The shares have underperformed the S&P 500 by 0.18% during the past week but   outperformed the index in 4 weeks by 0.45%. 
S&T Bancorp Inc. is up 15.08%   4.21%. The company shares have rallied 23% in the past 52 Weeks. On July 22, 2015 The shares registered one year high of $32.88 and one year low was seen on October 8, 2014 at $23.07. The 50-day moving average is $30.45 and the 200 day moving average is recorded at $28.81. S&P 500 has rallied 7.26% during the last 52-weeks. 
The company has received recommendation from many analysts. The shares have been rated as hold from 3 Wall Street Analysts. 2 analysts have suggested buy for the company. 
On a different note, The Company has disclosed insider buying and selling activities to the Securities Exchange, The Securities and Exchange Commission has divulged that Gibson James Thomas, director of S&T Bancorp Inc, had unloaded 25,000 shares at an average price of $31.3 in a transaction dated on July 24, 2015. The total value of the transaction was worth $782,500. 
Shares of S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) ended Friday session in red amid volatile trading. The shares closed down 0.13 points or 0.42% at $30.48 with 61,823 shares getting traded. Post opening the session at $30.4, the shares hit an intraday low of $29.8901 and an intraday high of $30.63 and the price vacillated in this range throughout the day.
